description: Lenart Kova makes the decision to leak the burned Council privilege ledger, believing exposing corruption is necessary to hold leadership accountable.
A burned ledger detailing high-level privilege exceptions is discreetly placed by Lenart in an area being cleaned by protestors near Council chambers.
Protestors discover the charred privilege ledger. News spreads rapidly online, confirming systematic BCI favoritism for Council insiders and sparking citywide outrage.
Public demonstrations intensify, with demands for nullification of all privilege exceptions and the restoration of fairness in the BCI system. Council factions are thrown into open conflict.

Under mounting public anger and leadership infighting, BCI restrictions become erratic as officials attempt hasty fixes. City governance lurches toward breakdown amid growing calls for systemic change.
